Posts.Content: Hey Cindy and Kat, Hope all is well with you both. I received my PATH report and just wanted to say that Im SO glad I went with bi-lateral mastectomy!! My tumor was very small(1.6 cm) but spread to 8 out of 11 nodes under my arm...aggressive lil bugger!!! Theyve changed me to Stage IIIa with all the node involvement...even doc said they werent expecting to find any let alone 8!! Somehow I just knew that I should go the drastic route to fight this and I WAS RIGHT!! Goes to show that u really can and should trust those instincts!! I start my chemo on the 25th of this month...4 rounds of AC, 12 roundsof Taxol followed with rads and hormone therapy. I hope its ready...cause Im gonna kick its ass!!! Hope you both keep in touch and let me know how your doing...take care!!! ~Kris

Posts.Title: Not quite 30,newly diagnosed and WAITING!!

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for the reply!!!! It was a really hard choice to get a bi-lateral mastectomy. Everyone kept saying "It'll be okay, you'll have new perfectly matched boobs and perky!!"..stuff like that...but it doesnt change the fact that youre losing yours. (Its more difficult than I thought looking down at my new body and still trying to feel whole?) But after reading so many posts of reoccurence on other breast and considering my own family history with cancer, I figured better safe then sorry right?! I wish you all the best on your appointment...waiting is one of the worst parts!! Somehow easier when you know exactly what youre up against and have a plan. I cant wait yet Im dreading it Please keep me posted!!! [HUGS] ~Kris

Posts.Title: Not quite 30,newly diagnosed and WAITING!!

Posts.Content: Hi everyone. Im a 29 yr old mom of two boys 5 and 7. I was diagnosed with Stage II ductal carcinoma and area of DCIS on Oct 27, 2009(I was 2 I had a bi-lateral mastectomy on Jan. 11th and 4 lymphnodes came back positive on Pathology report. They've told me that Ill need chemo probably followed with radiation but to heal up from surgery for this month. Im waiting to go back on Feb. 9th to learn what treatment plan or plans are ahead to beat this thing. I try to stay busy and keep my mind focused on ANYTHING else at least until I know whats ahead, but here I sit at 1:30am feverishly reading posts and comments just to feel like I havent lost my mind!!!! I dont have a question or specific comment to make just wanted to say thats its nice to have a site to be ABLE to do that when you need to...glad I didnt find you a month ago or you may have all thought I turly was crazy...lol!!! My thoughts and prayers go out to you all!!!! [cyberHUGS] ~Kris

Posts.Content: Hi Im 29 and just diagnosed with breast cancer in Oct. My doctor told me the same thing(too much caffine and Im a smoker) and even though I knew something just felt "different" I brushed it off because my doctor assured me it was nothing. Please dont freak out or anything,lol,Im not saying you'll habe same results but its something worth pushing for!!! Had I have pushed long ago I probably wouldnt have had a bilateral mastectomy and spreading into my lymph nodes so PLEASE please be a b*@#*(dunno if i can say what i wanted to???) on this one and MAKE them biopsy it!!! Lol Let me know what happens ~Kris
